q_en: What are the sewing tasks for Dress's product type?
gt:
Sure! Let's dive into the sewing tasks for dresses. Here‚Äôs a detailed breakdown of the tasks:

| Task ID | Start Time       | End Time         | Working Group     | Product ID | Planned Number | Completed Number | Status       |
|---------|------------------|------------------|-------------------|------------|----------------|------------------|--------------|
| 11      | 2024-03-21       | 2024-04-14       | Premier Sewers    | 21         | 140            | 100              | In Progress  |
| 12      | 2024-03-27       | 2024-04-12       | Master Sewers     | 29         | 150            | 120              | Completed    |
| 13      | 2024-03-27       | 2024-04-06       | Master Sewers     | 13         | 130            | 120              | Completed    |
| 14      | 2024-03-18       | 2024-04-08       | Master Sewers     | 5          | 120            | 120              | Completed    |

### Product Details
- **Product ID 5**: Pink, S size
- **Product ID 13**: Black, S size
- **Product ID 21**: Gold, L size
- **Product ID 29**: Red, M size

The sewing tasks are being handled by the talented "Premier Sewers" and "Master Sewers" teams. Keep up the great work! üéâ If you have any more questions, feel free to ask! üòä

steps.sql: SELECT p.id FROM products p JOIN products_types pt ON p.products_type_id = pt.id WHERE pt.description = 'Dress';
steps.description: Retrieve the product IDs for products with type "Dress"

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM order_product WHERE product_id IN (5, 13, 21, 29);
steps.description: Retrieve the order_product IDs for the products identified in Step1

steps.sql: SELECT st.id, st.start_time, st.end_time, wg.name AS working_group_name, op.product_id, st.planned_number, st.completed_number, st.status FROM sewing_tasks st JOIN working_group wg ON st.working_group_id = wg.id JOIN order_product op ON st.order_product_id = op.id WHERE st.order_product_id IN (14, 13, 11, 12);
steps.description: Retrieve the sewing tasks for the order_product IDs identified in Step2

steps.sql: SELECT p.attributes, pt.description FROM products p JOIN products_types pt ON p.products_type_id = pt.id WHERE p.id IN (5, 13, 21, 29);
steps.description: Replace product IDs with their attributes and type description
